channel.title: A port forwarding problem
channel.description:
Hi.
I'm new here and would like to get some help for port forwarding... I'm using A-link BR84. So I go to my "router page" and I click to advanced -> firewall -> port forwarding. it opens a page for port fowarding but im noob and i dont know what to do :P So there is
[img]http://i28.tinypic.com/2uprcls.jpg[/img]
After enable is a box what you can check and uncheck -> so what do i do? And can I put any name I want on the name place? And after name is a "thing" where you can chose the name of your game WTF? so do I just leave it blank? And finaly, do i leave the UDP "thing" blank?
I would like to get help asap cuz my server has been ready for 2 weeks...
-Thanks for reading this :P

item.title: A port forwarding problem
item.dc:creator: @pinkyownz_all pinkyownz all
item.description:
@pinkyownz_all wrote:

You don’t leave anything blank you put your port in the udp port and the tcp, and your ip adress your ip, DUH!, for the name the game your playing -.- and the enable obviously click it hope i helped.

Read full topic

item.title: A port forwarding problem

item.description:
@koppanen wrote:

Hi.

I’m new here and would like to get some help for port forwarding… I’m using A-link BR84.
So I go to my “router page” and I click to advanced -> firewall -> port forwarding. it opens a page for port fowarding but im noob and i dont know what to do So there is

And can I put any name I want on the name place?
And after name is a “thing” where you can chose the name of your game WTF? so do I just leave it blank?
And finaly, do i leave the UDP “thing” blank?

I would like to get help asap cuz my server has been ready for 2 weeks…
